trans-unit.source: Delete Search Service
trans-unit.target: Delete Search Service

trans-unit.source: Delete Search Service (Azure Search Management REST API)
trans-unit.target: Delete Search Service (Azure Search Management REST API)

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Delete Search Service</languageKeyword> operation deletes the Search service and search data, including all indexes and documents.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Delete Search Service</languageKeyword> operation deletes the Search service and search data, including all indexes and documents.

trans-unit.source: NOTE: Administrators and developers are accustomed to backing up application data before deleting it from a production server.
trans-unit.target: NOTE: Administrators and developers are accustomed to backing up application data before deleting it from a production server.

trans-unit.source: In Azure Search, there is no backup operation.
trans-unit.target: In Azure Search, there is no backup operation.

trans-unit.source: If you are using the index as primary storage for your application, you will need to use the Search operation to return all of the data in the index, which you can store externally.
trans-unit.target: If you are using the index as primary storage for your application, you will need to use the Search operation to return all of the data in the index, which you can store externally.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is required for all service requests.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is required for all service requests.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Delete Search Service</languageKeyword> request is constructed using the DELETE method.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Delete Search Service</languageKeyword> request is constructed using the DELETE method.

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: Request Parameter
trans-unit.target: Request Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>subscriptionID</codeInline> for the Azure user.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>subscriptionID</codeInline> for the Azure user.

trans-unit.source: You can obtain this value from the Azure Resource Manager API or the portal.
trans-unit.target: You can obtain this value from the Azure Resource Manager API or the portal.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The name of the resource group within the user’s subscription.
trans-unit.target: The name of the resource group within the user’s subscription.

trans-unit.source: You can obtain this value from the Azure Resource Manager API or the portal.
trans-unit.target: You can obtain this value from the Azure Resource Manager API or the portal.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The name of the search service within the specified resource group.
trans-unit.target: The name of the search service within the specified resource group.

trans-unit.source: If you don't know the service name, you can obtain a list using <link xlink:href="476d5360-2219-4b51-8e72-3cc6b08386ec" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Search Services (Azure Search API)</link>.
trans-unit.target: If you don't know the service name, you can obtain a list using <link xlink:href="476d5360-2219-4b51-8e72-3cc6b08386ec" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Search Services (Azure Search API)</link>.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The version of the protocol used for this request.
trans-unit.target: The version of the protocol used for this request.

trans-unit.source: The current version is <codeInline>2015-02-28</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The current version is <codeInline>2015-02-28</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: The previous version, <codeInline>2014-07-31-Preview</codeInline>, is deprecated.
trans-unit.target: The previous version, <codeInline>2014-07-31-Preview</codeInline>, is deprecated.

trans-unit.source: Although it will continue to work for the next several months, we encourage you to transition to the current version as soon as possible.
trans-unit.target: Although it will continue to work for the next several months, we encourage you to transition to the current version as soon as possible.

trans-unit.target: The following table describes the required and optional request headers.

trans-unit.target: If specified, this will be included in response information as a way to map the request.

trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.

trans-unit.source: Status Code
trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.source: For HTTP 200, the response body will be empty.
trans-unit.target: For HTTP 200, the response body will be empty.

trans-unit.source: HTTP 200 (OK) is the correct response if the resource does not exist.
trans-unit.target: HTTP 200 (OK) is the correct response if the resource does not exist.

trans-unit.source: You can use <languageKeyword>Get Search Service API</languageKeyword> to poll the status of the deleting service.
trans-unit.target: You can use <languageKeyword>Get Search Service API</languageKeyword> to poll the status of the deleting service.

trans-unit.source: We recommend polling intervals of 30 seconds to a minute.
trans-unit.target: We recommend polling intervals of 30 seconds to a minute.

trans-unit.target: Response Header

trans-unit.source: The following headers are part of the response.
trans-unit.target: The following headers are part of the response.

trans-unit.target: Response Header

trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: A unique identifier for the current operation generated by the service.
trans-unit.target: A unique identifier for the current operation generated by the service.

trans-unit.target: Response Body

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.
